• Always have a bucket and hose nearby in the event of an emergency.

Dear Families,

In light of the Governor's new order, we are certainly in unprecedented times. We have every faith in our Administration, Teachers and Staff that they will analyze and implement a plan that will best fit the academic, social and emotional needs of the students in our district to the best of their ability.

We are all in this together and we must all work together for the children in our District.

The Climax-Scotts' Board of Education requests our community to join us in support of our Administrators, Teachers, Staff and Students.

Thank you,

Climax-Scotts' Board of Education

shared_text:
Climax-Scotts Elementary School
March 11 at 1:15 PM ·

A huge thank you to Dr. Jeffrey Driscoll, who visited our building yesterday and brought his science dome and hands on activities to our science scholars!

The students learned about stars, planets, constellations, the universe and more! They also built with various structures and manipulated special sand and slime. They all learned a lot and had a blast that was “out of this world"!!

A shout out of gratitude goes to Jeffrey Driscoll, to Climax Methodist Church, and to Jo Ramsdell’s sales of “Bip’s Stories”, which made this extra science learning possible for our students!!!

It takes a village, and we have an amazing one!!

September 12, 2019 at 7:58 AM ·

Hello Families,
We are pleased to announce that in addition to offering our upper el after school art program this year, we are now able to offer lower el art club as well!

These clubs are sponsored by our Music Boosters and we are so appreciative of them! Please consider volunteering at any after school game in our concessions to show your appreciation too 💙

Both clubs will meet after school twice per month on Tuesdays from 3:45-5:00. More info in start dates once we have the registration info.

There are six slots left for upper el club, grades 3-5, and fifteen slots for lower el club, grades K-2.

Registration is in our office and an adult must come in to register their child(ren)

Mrs. Srmek will teach the upper el class and Miss Reed will teach the lower el class.

We are appreciative of Mrs. Srmek and Miss Reed for taking these classes this year!
Your CS Family Team

September 10, 2019 at 7:01 AM ·

CS Jr./Sr. High Announcements:

For the last few years Old National Bank has hosted a Tools for Schools campaign, where during the month of September communities have the chance to vote for their favorite school to win a $1,000 Tools for Schools grant. Votes will be collected at www.oldnational.com/toolsforschools. From this page, the voter can select their state and city, then their favorite school. A list of eligible schools has been pre-populated to make the voting process as easy as possible. Eligible schools include public and non-public schools within the Old National footprint that are listed on state’s department of education site. The community can vote as often as they like for their school of choice (only one vote per day). A bonus! If we hit 30,000 Facebook Likes by September 30, the school with the most overall votes gets a $5,000 Tools for Schools Grant!

As a plucky schoolboy with a burning desire to entertain, Will began honing his performance skills. In appreciation of our great community support, we invited Jake Hinga, a C-S graduate, to display his talents and experience by starring in, and producing, a one hour circus show on Sunday, September 8th at 4:00 pm, in the Jr/Sr High School gym (seats 950).

Jake has worked for companies like SeaWorld, Six Flags and Big Apple Circus and wants to bring a one of a kind show back to Climax-Scotts. He is a representation of what's possible coming from a small town and a supportive school system. The hour-long show will have a theme of "community" and will feature acts such as juggling, magic, aerial, cyr wheel, and Trampwall.

In order to assure all students and their family members are able to enjoy the show and see the completed construction, we will not be charging an admission but will cover the cost through contractor and private donations.
